sections.title: EV Math
sections.content: The important numbers behind EV training
bullets: Each Pokemon can have a total of 510 EVs
A maximum of 255 EVs in a single stat
Each 4 EVs in a stat results in a +1 increase in that stat (at level 100)
So any EV after a multiple of 4 is wasted (for example, 10 EVs in a stat only gives +2, while 12 EVs gives +3)
252 EVs in a stat gives +63 at level 100 because 252 / 4 = 63 with no remainder
So maxing a stat to 255 is wasting 3 EVs that could be used elsewhere
The common practice is to max out 2 stats (252 EVs each) and put the remaining 6 EVs into a third stat
This gives the most overall stat increases (63 + 63 + 1 = 127 total increase)
An example would be a 'Physical Sweeper' with 252 Attack EVs, 252 Speed EVs, and 6 HP EVs (still 2 wasted EVs but it can't be helped)
See more roles in the Team Building guide

Speed: Wild Zone 1 - All Pok√©mon here except for Scatterbug and Mareep
High-level: These zones (11-20) will have the highest level Pok√©mon that give the desired EVs, making it easier to level up while EV training
HP: Wild Zone 12 - Snorunt and Gogoat
Attack: Wild Zone 12 - Snover, Abomasnow, Machop, and Machoke; Wild Zone 13 - All Pok√©mon here except for Vivillon

If you start with all of your Pok√©mon with 0 EV for that stat, you can check only one Pok√©mon's stat summary screen to see when you have maxed out the EVs for that stat (it will say 'Max EVs' under the stat)

sections.content: The 4 states of wild Pok√©mon and how they behave

3. Battle/Aggro: Pok√©mon are actively trying to attack you
